page.title: 11OLD BUILDINGS-BARNARD CASTLE
page.content: For both local people and visitors to Barnard Castle there are buildings of historic interest.The most obvious one is the Norman Castle from which the town got its name.Founded in 1112 by Bernard,son of Guy de Baliol a Norman knight.The Market Cross or "Buttermarket" as some locals call it, now serves as an unusual traffic island. It is an octagonal building dating from 1747 and was once the Town Hall and covered market.Not far down the Bank is Blagraves,dating from the early 16th century,it is now a high class restaurant and was once the inn where probably Oliver Cromwell stayed. Some of the hotels were built in the 17th century and the King's Head,which is the largest hotel,is where Charles Dickens stayed in 1838 when collecting material for Nicholas Nickleby.
